topic.title: Adding the Rados Gateway to Existing Cloud

body.section:
Introduction
The Entry-scale KVM with Ceph model in has been extended to include support for RADOS Gateway. If you are upgrading an existing cloud and you want to enable RADOS Gateway functionality, you will need to add new servers, roles, disk models and clusters to your model.
This describes how to add a RADOS gateway component to a pre-deployed cloud that is not running this service.
The networking aspects of the Entry Scale KVM with Ceph model has changed in . Previously, a Ceph deployment used a single network where the default deployment uses a three-network based cluster. Make sure that you make appropriate changes in the input model to add only RADOS gateway service to avoid affecting other networks being used by the Ceph service (such as OSD or monitoring). The upgrade to might lead to changes in network architectures for the Ceph service component and affect your user workload. For example, instances might lose connectivity to Ceph volumes. While following the Upgrade Instructions to upgrade a running HOS 2.x cloud to HOS 3.0, before executing the configuration processor, execute the following steps to install the Rados Gateway service.
To add a RADOS Gateway:
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml to add the following values under the clusters section:- name: rgw cluster-prefix: rgw server-role: RGW-ROLE min-count: 0 allocation-policy: strict service-components: - ntp-client - ceph-radosgw - apache2
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/server_roles.yml to add the following values:- name: RGW-ROLE interface-model: RGW-INTERFACES disk-model: RGW-DISKS
Copy the ~/helion/examples/entry-scale-kvm-ceph/data/disks_rgw.yml file to ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/ directory of your input model.
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/net_interfaces.yml file and update the network interfaces to match the deployment environment appropriately:- name: RGW-INTERFACES network-interfaces: - name: BOND0 device: name: bond0 bond-data: options: mode: active-backup miimon: 200 primary: hed3 provider: linux devices: - name: hed3 - name: hed4 network-groups: - MANAGEMENT - OSD-CLIENT
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/network_groups.yml file to add the RADOS Gateway service (ceph-radosgw) to the OSD-CLIENT network group:- name: OSD-CLIENT hostname-suffix: osd-client component-endpoints: - ceph-monitor - ceph-osd - ceph-radosgw
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml file. For each RADOS Gateway server to be added to the Ceph cluster, add a section, similar to the following example. Update all the fields based on your environment:- id: rgw1 ip-addr: 192.168.10.12 role: RGW-ROLE server-group: RACK1 nic-mapping: MY-2PORT-SERVER mac-addr: "8b:f6:9e:ca:3b:62" ilo-ip: 192.168.9.12 ilo-password: password ilo-user: admin
Commit your configuration changes:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "<commit message>"
Provision the baremetal nodes by following the Provision Your Baremetal Nodes section in Installation for Helion Entry-scale Cloud with KVM page.
Resume the Upgrade Instructions from the step for executing configuration processor.
